title: Interpreting Scatter Plots
question_text: When interpreting a scatter plot, what are some prominent features one should point out?
solution:
When interpreting a scatterplot the main topics are strength (strong, weak, moderate), direction (positive or negative), and form (linear, exponential, etc.).

It also can be useful to mention any clusters or unusual features in the scatterplot.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', 'C', and 'E' are incorrect; these all are ways to interpret single variable data. However, a scatterplot deals with bivariate data (two variables).
